meanings.definition: The day of the week on which clothes are washed.
meanings.sent1: On washdays, Mom always does the laundry.
meanings.sent2: Saturday is our washday when we clean all our clothes.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought washdays were fun because she could play with the wet clothes.
meanings.sent4: The rhythm of washdays is like a soothing melody in our household.
meanings.sent5: Children eagerly anticipate washdays to see the magic of dirty clothes turning clean.

meanings.definition: A day set aside for washing clothes.
meanings.sent1: Every Monday is our washday, and we make sure all clothes are clean by evening.
meanings.sent2: Having a specific washday helps us stay organized with our laundry.
meanings.sent3: The washday tradition in our family involves singing while folding clothes.
meanings.sent4: The calmness of a washday is like a peaceful retreat from the busyness of the week.
meanings.sent5: Washdays bring a sense of accomplishment as we see our clothes neatly hung to dry.
